intro: Thlaspi cartilagineum, commonly known as the cartilaginous cabbageworm, is a flowering plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold climates. Thlaspi cartilagineum is often found in mountainous areas and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological and evolutionary significance.
